column4: Diagnosis of exclusion. Various degrees of differentiation

Well-differentiated, superficially spreading simulating 
pseudoepitheliomatous hyperplasia

Poorly-differentiated carcinoma with acantholytic 
pseudolumina simulating glands

Extremely well-differentiated, broad-based, and pushing 
tumour front. No metastasis reported

Endophytic labyrinthine growth pattern with broad-based 
pushing margins.

Papillae covered by well- to moderately differentiated cells 
without koilocytes

Biphasic epithelial and spindle cell neoplasia. Most 
aggressive and worse prognosis.

Two or more subtypes in the same specimen. Prognosis is 
related to the subtypes involved.

Uniform basaloid cells in nests or sheets, with 
comedonecrosis or abrupt keratinisation.

Condylomatous papillae with central fibrovascular cores and 
koilocytes.

Nests or sheets of cells with ample, clear cytoplasm with 
central of geographical necrosis.

Poorly differentiated cells intermixed with dense 
lymphoplasmacytic and eosinophilic infiltrate.
Mainly Warty-basaloid carcinoma according to the WHO 2022.
